text: All you Edgar players. I got him put together last night and just wanted to let you know how good [[demonic collusion]] is if you are working the vampire madness subtheme.

attachments.fallback: Demonic Collusion {3}{B}{B} // Sorcery // Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.) // Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Buyback—Discard two cards. _(You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)_
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
attachments.title: Demonic Collusion {3}{B}{B}

text: Seems expensive....why not [[Call the Bloodline]] for a madness enabler? For card draw in Edgar, [[Minions' Murmurs]] fits the bill, as <@U4V5EHQ2G> can attest.

attachments.fallback: Call the Bloodline {1}{B} // Enchantment // {1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 black Vampire Knight creature token with lifelink. Activate this ability only once each turn.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
{1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 black Vampire Knight creature token with lifelink. Activate this ability only once each turn.
_At Sorin's appeal, Olivia Voldaren summoned the full might of her bloodline to gather at Lurenbraum Fortress._
attachments.title: Call the Bloodline {1}{B}

attachments.fallback: Minions' Murmurs {2}{B}{B} // Sorcery // You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.
_"They are quick to offer advice, those whose mistakes doomed them to undeath. How can I not listen to the wisdom of failure?" —Ratadrabik of Urborg_
attachments.title: Minions' Murmurs {2}{B}{B}

text: I forced a terrible Rift last night that he was clearly saving for a win in a few turns but he had to cast it to keep me from drawing 12
Good...tricky blue players and their rifts...
Then I was just able to recast 3 of the vampires and my board was back up to 6 guys in play.
Did the blue player cry?
I use both of those as well. Nailing low curve vamps while tutoring just felt so good I needed to share.
I subbed collusion in place of increasing ambition as a goof since I decided to go the low curve route. I like it so far.

I can see it in a madness deck. I don't really have anything that would care aside from Asylum Visitor and Falkenrath Gorger, so it's not worth for me over [[Dark Petition]] or something, but I can see how it would work

attachments.fallback: Dark Petition {3}{B}{B} // Sorcery // Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library. // Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
_Spell mastery_ — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
attachments.title: Dark Petition {3}{B}{B}

text: The only problem is to get the madness value off Collusion you have to have 6 or more mana, so you can't use it early if you need to without some serious card disadvantage.

Yeah luckily phyrexian arena and vampiric rites and vanquishers banner help keep our hands fed and heralds horn and urzas incubator make our already cheap vamps next to nothing. I also push Strom kirk condemned and Olivia mobilized for war to help with discard.
And key to the city. Don't forget that.
Dana's draw density is high enough that he could probably pull it off in his deck, too
I'm wanting to build a unique Boros deck.
Wheels and Phoenixes.
With Alms Collector
Phoenixes?
Yeah, the red creatures that rise from the grave.
Ok. Just making sure that’s what he meant.
Hey <@U3QMCLQQG>, here's a challenge for you. Build it with [[adriana, captain of the guard]] as the general.

Anyone ever used [[Infernal Tribute]]? I was looking for a way to sacrifice my enchantments in Xiahou Dun to avoid getting blown out by a merciless eviction and it's one of the few ways I see in black to sacrifice non-creatures.

attachments.fallback: Infernal Tribute {B}{B}{B} // Enchantment // {2}, Sacrifice a nontoken permanent: Draw a card.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
{2}, Sacrifice a nontoken permanent: Draw a card.
_"I would not barter my soul for any of the filth that they called power. So they took it from me and damned me to solitude." —Crovax_
attachments.title: Infernal Tribute {B}{B}{B}
